title.narrative: Youth Bank Chimoio: enabling 2,500 young women and men to improve their livelihoods and pioneering a new movement for social and economic entrepreneurship in Mozambique

description.narrative: This project takes the Youth Bank methodology first developed in Northern Ireland and adapts it to Mozambique. In various countries of the world YouthBank organizations have succeeded in mobilizing young people from different backgrounds and forging collaboration and joint action, usually involving local grantmaking. Youth Bank Chimoio (YBC) is the first attempt to launch a youth-led grant making programme in Mozambique. YBC is run by young people, for young people. The grants component will stimulate social and economic entrepreneurship and local resource mobilisation (volunteering and financial) that could be a basis for establishing a form of community foundation. The project aims to enable more than 2,500 young men and women to plot their own paths out of poverty and through the project we will establish a model that in principle can be widely replicated in Mozambique.
